com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.util

Class EventBus

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.exacttarget.etpushsdk.util.EventBus

  • public class EventBus
extends Object
    EventBus allows your application to listen in on events you might be interested in that happen in the ExactTarget SDK. Your class must register with the EventBus and have public methods defined that start with "onEvent...". The EventBus will call these methods in your class whenever they occur in the system. Events should treated as immutable and should not be modified by your handler methods. 

     
 public class MyActivity extends Activity {
  ...
  @Override
  public void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState) {
    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);
    ...
    EventBus.getInstance().register(this);
    ...
  }

  @Override
  public void onDestroy() {
    super.onDestroy();
    ...
    EventBus.getInstance().unregister(this);
    ...
  }

  public void onEventLocationChanged(final LastKnownLocationEvent event) {
    locationText.setText("Provider: "+event.getLocation().getProvider()+", Lat: "+event.getLocation().getLatitude()+", Lon: "+event.getLocation().getLongitude()+", Accuracy: "+event.getLocation().getAccuracy()+", Timestamp: "+new Date(event.getLocation().getTime()));
  }

 }

      • getDefault

        @Deprecated
public static EventBus getDefault()
        Deprecated. use getInstance() instead.
        Getter method for the EventBus singleton

        EventBus

      • getInstance

        public static EventBus getInstance()
        Getter method for the EventBus singleton
        Returns:
        EventBus

      • register

        public void register(Object listener)
        Register the passed class so it's onEvent handler methods can receive events. If the passed class is listening to any events that have previously been posted as sticky, the onEvent handler methods will be immediately called with the last sticky event.
        Parameters:
        listener - our object to register

      • unregister

        public void unregister(Object listener)
        Unregister a listener class
        Parameters:
        listener - our registered object

      • post

        public void post(Object event)
        Post an event onto the bus. Handlers listening for this type of object will be notified.
        Parameters:
        event - an event to post to the EventBus

      • postSticky

        public void postSticky(Object event)
        Post an event onto the bus and save it. Any handlers registering later for this event type will be notified immediately when they register for the EventBus.
        Parameters:
        event - an event to PostSticky to the EventBus

      • getStickyEvent

        public Object getStickyEvent(Class<?> clazz)
        Convenience method for grabbing the last sticky event for a given event type without having to register.
        Parameters:
        clazz - the object type previously posted to the bus
        Returns:
        Object representing the sticky event
